summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the status of deferred prosecution agreements (DPAs) in a case referred to as 'Noel'. The correspondence is in the context of needing to provide an update to the court or check in with The New York Times regarding timing in an Epstein-related FOIA matter.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: The deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case are the subject of the email chain, with prosecutors needing a determination on them to manage an Epstein FOIA matter.

events.title: Deadline for Court Update on Epstein FOIA
events.description: The email indicates a need to provide an update and/or seek more time from the Court by Wednesday (April 28, 2021) in the Epstein FOIA case, contingent on the status of the Noel DPAs.

events.title: Initial Inquiry on Noel DPA Status
events.description: An initial email was sent inquiring about the status of deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case, linking it to the need to update the Court or The New York Times about timing in the Epstein FOIA.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively managing an Epstein-related FOIA case as of April 2021.
The resolution of deferred prosecution agreements in a separate case, 'Noel', was directly tied to the timing of updates required in the Epstein FOIA matter.
The office anticipated needing to communicate with The New York Times regarding the timing of the Epstein FOIA proceedings.
The correspondence shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on overlapping legal matters.
